alert.note: Alert for Schoharie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 19 at 12:03PM EST until February 19 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Schoharie County in east central New York... * Until 100 PM EST. * At 1203 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Sharon Springs to Colliersville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 88 between exits 20 and 23. Locations impacted include... Cobleskill, Summit, Schoharie, Richmondville, Sharon Springs, Central Bridge, Carlisle, Sharon, Seward, Esperance, Zeh Corners, Beekman Corners, West Richmondville, Warnerville, Engleville, Gardnersville, Becker Corners, Shutts Corners, Barnerville and Dorloo. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.
